name: European Historic Thermal Towns Association
goal: The EHTTA was created in 2009 in Brussels, and a year later was designated by the Council of Europe as a Cultural Route, one of just 33 across Europe.  The aims of this European network are to obtain recognition for the innovative and cultural qualities of European spa towns within the European Union, in order to develop a new plan for the tourist sector by encouraging cross-border tourism in the framework of "Destination Europe". EHTTA encourages the economic development of spa towns and the safeguarding of their cultural and built heritage through exchanges of experience and good practices at the European level.
interests: Communication, Culture, Education, Enterprise, Environment, Public Health, Research and Technology, Sport, Trans-European Networks, Youth
euInitiatives: The European directive 2011/24 which gives patients rights to  cross-border healthcare and helps patients to make an informed choice when they seek to receive healthcare in another Member State. The thermal towns are perfectly situated to host European citizens who travel to spa destinations across Europe improve their health.
